Text: search
here you will find a number of resources that we hope you might find useful.
change coach dk briefing notes
a series of articles on a range of topics that go into more depth than is possible on the web site. the briefing notes are available in pdf format and are released under creative commons license, so that you can use them as you wish. please complete the form below to tell us which briefing notes you would like.
briefing note 1:â     what is coaching?â   in this briefing note we attempt to bring some clarity to what is a potentially confusing situation and to arrive at a comprehensive definition of coaching as understood byâ  change coach  dk  – and one that is relevant to both corporate and individual clients as they look to manage change and transformation.
briefing note 2: motivational interviewing and coaching: uneasy bedfellows?â   motivational interviewing (mi) is an approach to helping people with change situations that has its roots firmly in the domain of therapy. its effectiveness has been demonstrated in quite literally hundreds of studies. we firmly believe that coachingâ   is notâ   therapy, so the question arises; does motivational interviewing have anything to offer the coaching situation? in this briefing note we demonstrate that both the “spirit” and the skills involved in mi provide valuable additional tools in helping individuals and groups engage with change situations.
briefing note 3: that surgeon is a butcher: more on mysterious metaphor
imagine the situation; you are meeting with a friend who recently underwent minor surgery for a non-critical condition. the surgery was successful in the sense that the condition has resolved, however your friend is less than happy with the resulting scar. upon meeting you ask, â€œhow did your operation go?â€� they reply, â€œit went ok but that surgeon is a butcherâ€�. now, upon hearing your friend respond in this way you would immediately know what they mean despite the fact that they are clearly using a metaphor â€“ you would, in all likelihood, make the pragmatic assumption that your friend had not in fact been operated upon by a real butcher and, thus, that the use of the word â€œbutcherâ€� is not to be taken literally. furthermore you would, in all likelihood, â€œgetâ€� what your friend meant in a completely effortless way, even if you had never heard the phrase â€œthat surgeon is a butcherâ€� before.
following on from an earlier blog post, this briefing note examines on account of how metaphors come to have meaning.
warning: it’s a bit longer than other briefing notes, but i hope it repays the effort of reading it.
briefing note 4: mirror neurons – the key to knowing about others?
how is it that we understand other people? it might seem like an odd question, but, for all its apparent oddness, it is nonetheless an important one – particularly for people who make their living by claiming to have particular skills in understanding others.
nouns that take the prefix “neuro-” are quite fashionable at the moment – “neuro-management”, “neuro-economics”, “neuro-coaching” are just three examples picked up from commentaries recently. in some ways this is to be celebrated because it represents something of an acknowledgement that studying the functioning of the brain might have something to teach us in the domains of management, econmics and coaching respectively. atâ   change coach   dk   we don’t think there is really a need to invent new academic disciplines, but there is a need to take the learning and insights from academia and consider how they might apply to the domains in which we work. â some of the most important insights of the past few years have emerged from social cognition and neuroscience. in this briefing note we give an account of the way in which the architecture of the brain might – or might not – explain how other people’s behaviour is meaningful to you and me.
warning: it’s not only a bit longer than other briefing notes, but also a bit technical, but again i hope it repays the effort of reading it.
useful links
the international journal of evidence based coaching and mentoring â  is a peer-reviewed open access online journal produced by oxford brooks university in the uk. often useful and always interesting articles and reviews contributed by both academics and practitioners.
us dk expats â  is a website run by charlotte wittenkamp. charlotte has experience of both denmark and of expat life. there is lots of useful information on her website, but the link is specifically to information about cross-cultural living.
share this:

resources | change coach dk change coach dk careers guidance, mentoring and coaching services to the expatriate and english speaking community in denmark search main menu skip to primary content home our services about us how we work resources contact us blog resources here you will find a number of resources that we hope you might find useful. change coach dk briefing notes a series of articles on a range of topics that go into more depth than is possible on the web site. the briefing notes are available in pdf format and are released under creative commons license, so that you can use them as you wish. please complete the form below to tell us which briefing notes you would like. briefing note 1:  what is coaching?  in this briefing note we attempt to bring some clarity to what is a potentially confusing situation and to arrive at a comprehensive definition of coaching as understood by  change coach dk – and one that is relevant to both corporate and individual clients as they look to manage change and transformation. briefing note 2: motivational interviewing and coaching: uneasy bedfellows?  motivational interviewing (mi) is an approach to helping people with change situations that has its roots firmly in the domain of therapy. its effectiveness has been demonstrated in quite literally hundreds of studies. we firmly believe that coaching  is not  therapy, so the question arises; does motivational interviewing have anything to offer the coaching situation? in this briefing note we demonstrate that both the “spirit” and the skills involved in mi provide valuable additional tools in helping individuals and groups engage with change situations. briefing note 3: that surgeon is a butcher: more on mysterious metaphor imagine the situation; you are meeting with a friend who recently underwent minor surgery for a non-critical condition. the surgery was successful in the sense that the condition has resolved, however your friend is less than happy with the resulting scar. upon meeting you ask, “how did your operation go?” they reply, “it went ok but that surgeon is a butcher”. now, upon hearing your friend respond in this way you would immediately know what they mean despite the fact that they are clearly using a metaphor – you would, in all likelihood, make the pragmatic assumption that your friend had not in fact been operated upon by a real butcher and, thus, that the use of the word “butcher” is not to be taken literally. furthermore you would, in all likelihood, “get” what your friend meant in a completely effortless way, even if you had never heard the phrase “that surgeon is a butcher” before. following on from an earlier blog post, this briefing note examines on account of how metaphors come to have meaning. warning: it’s a bit longer than other briefing notes, but i hope it repays the effort of reading it. briefing note 4: mirror neurons – the key to knowing about others? how is it that we understand other people? it might seem like an odd question, but, for all its apparent oddness, it is nonetheless an important one – particularly for people who make their living by claiming to have particular skills in understanding others. nouns that take the prefix “neuro-” are quite fashionable at the moment – “neuro-management”, “neuro-economics”, “neuro-coaching” are just three examples picked up from commentaries recently. in some ways this is to be celebrated because it represents something of an acknowledgement that studying the functioning of the brain might have something to teach us in the domains of management, econmics and coaching respectively. at  change coach dk we don’t think there is really a need to invent new academic disciplines, but there is a need to take the learning and insights from academia and consider how they might apply to the domains in which we work.  some of the most important insights of the past few years have emerged from social cognition and neuroscience. in this briefing note we give an account of the way in which the architecture of the brain might – or might not – explain how other people’s behaviour is meaningful to you and me. warning: it’s not only a bit longer than other briefing notes, but also a bit technical, but again i hope it repays the effort of reading it. useful links the international journal of evidence based coaching and mentoring   is a peer-reviewed open access online journal produced by oxford brooks university in the uk. often useful and always interesting articles and reviews contributed by both academics and practitioners. us dk expats   is a website run by charlotte wittenkamp. charlotte has experience of both denmark and of expat life. there is lots of useful information on her website, but the link is specifically to information about cross-cultural living. briefing note request form name (required) email (required) which briefing notes would you like? Text: authors
rel
html4 definition of the 'rel' attribute. here are some additional values, each of which can be used or omitted in any combination (unless otherwise noted, and except where prohibited by law) and their meanings,
symmetry
transitivity
and
inverse
if any.   please see the xfn home page for more information about xfn .
friendship (pick at most one)
contact
someone you know how to get in touch with. often symmetric.
acquaintance
someone who you have exchanged greetings and not much (if any) more — maybe a short conversation or two. often symmetric.
friend
someone you are a friend to. a compatriot, buddy, home(boy|girl) that you know. often symmetric.
physical
met
professional
co-worker
someone a person works with, or works at the same organization as. symmetric.  usually transitive.
colleague
someone in the same field of study/activity. symmetric. often transitive.
geographical (pick at most one)
co-resident
someone you share a street address with.  symmetric and transitive.
neighbor
someone who lives nearby, perhaps only at an adjacent street address or doorway.  symmetric. often transitive.
family (pick at most one)
child
a person's genetic offspring, or someone that a person has adopted and takes care of. inverse is parent.
parent
someone a person shares a parent with.  symmetric. usually transitive.
spouse
kin
a relative, someone you consider part of your extended family. symmetric and typically transitive.
romantic
muse
crush
date
sweetheart
someone with whom you are intimate and at least somewhat committed, typically exclusively. symmetric. not transitive.
identity
me
a link to yourself at a different url. exclusive of all other xfn values. required symmetric. there is an implicit "me" relation from the contents of a directory to the directory itself.
acknowledgments
copyright
xfn 1.1 profile
xfn 1.1 profile xfn 1.1 relationships meta data profile authors tantek çelik matthew mullenweg eric meyer as described in html4 meta data profiles . rel html4 definition of the 'rel' attribute. here are some additional values, each of which can be used or omitted in any combination (unless otherwise noted, and except where prohibited by law) and their meanings, symmetry , transitivity and inverse if any. please see the xfn home page for more information about xfn . friendship (pick at most one) contact someone you know how to get in touch with. often symmetric. acquaintance someone who you have exchanged greetings and not much (if any) more — maybe a short conversation or two. often symmetric. friend someone you are a friend to. a compatriot, buddy, home(boy|girl) that you know. often symmetric. physical met someone who you have actually met in person. symmetric. professional co-worker someone a person works with, or works at the same organization as. symmetric. usually transitive. colleague someone in the same field of study/activity. symmetric. often transitive. geographical (pick at most one) co-resident someone you share a street address with. symmetric and transitive. neighbor someone who lives nearby, perhaps only at an adjacent street address or doorway. symmetric. often transitive. family (pick at most one) child a person's genetic offspring, or someone that a person has adopted and takes care of. inverse is parent. parent inverse of child. sibling someone a person shares a parent with. symmetric. usually transitive. spouse someone you are married to. symmetric. not transitive. kin a relative, someone you consider part of your extended family. symmetric and typically transitive. romantic muse someone who brings you inspiration. no inverse. crush someone you have a crush on. no inverse. date someone you are dating. symmetric. not transitive. sweetheart someone with whom you are intimate and at least somewhat committed, typically exclusively. symmetric. not transitive. identity me a link to yourself at a different url. exclusive of all other xfn values. required symmetric. there is an implicit "me" relation from the contents of a directory to the directory itself. acknowledgments please see our thanks page for acknowledgments. copyright copyright © 2003–2016 gmpg . some rights reserved .
tantek çelik
matthew mullenweg
eric meyer

url:http://gmpg.org/xfn/11.php,date:null,extSize:4327,extDblChar:100,C1a:0,C2a:0,C2b:n,C3a:0,C3b:5 to#for#do#son#tor,C3c:0,C3d:0,C3e:0,C3f:0,C3g:1 to,C4a:en,C4b:en: HIGH (0.999996),C5a:,C5b:,C6a:6 to#by#at#person#for#have,C6b:0,C6c:0,C6d:1 person,C7a:0,C7b:0,C7c:10 bo#ns#or#ie#ker#ore#by#ing#er#ved,C7d:1 or,C7e:0,C7f:0,C7g:0,C7h:0,C8a:0,C8b:0,C8c:0,C9a:0,C9b:1 eas,C9c:0,C9d:0,C9e:0,C9f:n,C10a:0,C10b:1 per,C10c:0,C15a:y,C15b:org,C16a:,C17a:0,C18a:,intDanish:0.0,Source:NETARKIVET,calcDanishCode:-1070912
Text: authors
rel
html4 definition of the 'rel' attribute. here are some additional values, each of which can be used or omitted in any combination (unless otherwise noted, and except where prohibited by law) and their meanings,
symmetry
transitivity
and
inverse
if any.   please see the xfn home page for more information about xfn .
friendship (pick at most one)
contact
someone you know how to get in touch with. often symmetric.
acquaintance
someone who you have exchanged greetings and not much (if any) more — maybe a short conversation or two. often symmetric.
friend
someone you are a friend to. a compatriot, buddy, home(boy|girl) that you know. often symmetric.
physical
met
professional
co-worker
someone a person works with, or works at the same organization as. symmetric.  usually transitive.
colleague
someone in the same field of study/activity. symmetric. often transitive.
geographical (pick at most one)
co-resident
someone you share a street address with.  symmetric and transitive.
neighbor
someone who lives nearby, perhaps only at an adjacent street address or doorway.  symmetric. often transitive.
family (pick at most one)
child
a person's genetic offspring, or someone that a person has adopted and takes care of. inverse is parent.
parent
someone a person shares a parent with.  symmetric. usually transitive.
spouse
kin
a relative, someone you consider part of your extended family. symmetric and typically transitive.
romantic
muse
crush
date
sweetheart
someone with whom you are intimate and at least somewhat committed, typically exclusively. symmetric. not transitive.
identity
me
a link to yourself at a different url. exclusive of all other xfn values. required symmetric. there is an implicit "me" relation from the contents of a directory to the directory itself.
acknowledgments
copyright
xfn 1.1 profile
xfn 1.1 profile xfn 1.1 relationships meta data profile authors tantek çelik matthew mullenweg eric meyer as described in html4 meta data profiles . rel html4 definition of the 'rel' attribute. here are some additional values, each of which can be used or omitted in any combination (unless otherwise noted, and except where prohibited by law) and their meanings, symmetry , transitivity and inverse if any. please see the xfn home page for more information about xfn . friendship (pick at most one) contact someone you know how to get in touch with. often symmetric. acquaintance someone who you have exchanged greetings and not much (if any) more — maybe a short conversation or two. often symmetric. friend someone you are a friend to. a compatriot, buddy, home(boy|girl) that you know. often symmetric. physical met someone who you have actually met in person. symmetric. professional co-worker someone a person works with, or works at the same organization as. symmetric. usually transitive. colleague someone in the same field of study/activity. symmetric. often transitive. geographical (pick at most one) co-resident someone you share a street address with. symmetric and transitive. neighbor someone who lives nearby, perhaps only at an adjacent street address or doorway. symmetric. often transitive. family (pick at most one) child a person's genetic offspring, or someone that a person has adopted and takes care of. inverse is parent. parent inverse of child. sibling someone a person shares a parent with. symmetric. usually transitive. spouse someone you are married to. symmetric. not transitive. kin a relative, someone you consider part of your extended family. symmetric and typically transitive. romantic muse someone who brings you inspiration. no inverse. crush someone you have a crush on. no inverse. date someone you are dating. symmetric. not transitive. sweetheart someone with whom you are intimate and at least somewhat committed, typically exclusively. symmetric. not transitive. identity me a link to yourself at a different url. exclusive of all other xfn values. required symmetric. there is an implicit "me" relation from the contents of a directory to the directory itself. acknowledgments please see our thanks page for acknowledgments. copyright copyright © 2003–2016 gmpg . some rights reserved .
tantek çelik
matthew mullenweg
eric meyer

Text: wordpress  is web software you can use to create a beautiful website, blog, or app. we like to say that wordpress is both free and priceless at the same time.
the core software is built by hundreds of community volunteers, and when you’re ready for more there are thousands of plugins and themes available to transform your site into almost anything you can imagine . over 60 million people have chosen wordpress to power the place on the web they call “home” — we’d love you to join the family.

Text: theories about culture
under this tab you will find articles on how cultures differ from one another, how we learn, how we may communicate with people foreign to us, stereotyping and other traps.
cultural models and differences in communication patterns are explained in more detail in my book that you can download for free by using the link at the bottom of the page.
to see the cultural models and charts in a bigger format, click on the picture. to get back to the text, click on the back-to-the-previous-page left arrow.
theories about culture | us dk expats
theories about culture | us dk expats skip to main content us dk expats search form search main menu home theory local information resources blog biblio about me contact free book theories about culture under this tab you will find articles on how cultures differ from one another, how we learn, how we may communicate with people foreign to us, stereotyping and other traps. cultural models and differences in communication patterns are explained in more detail in my book that you can download for free by using the link at the bottom of the page. to see the cultural models and charts in a bigger format, click on the picture. to get back to the text, click on the back-to-the-previous-page left arrow. what is an expat? learning cultural adaptation prejudice and stereotypes communication what is culture? going home what is an expat? › theories about culture what is an expat? learning cultural adaptation prejudice and stereotypes communication what is culture? going home © 2011-2016 charlotte wittenkamp download free ebook: building bridges across cultural differences you can follow us dk expats and post comments to the blog on linkedin . following will give you automatic updates when i post a new article.

Text: xhtml vocabulary xhtml  vocabulary
this is a vocabulary collection utilized by xhtml  family modules and document types using xhtml  modularization , including xhtml  role and xhtml + rdfa as defined in rdfa-syntax .
version date: 2010-01-27
1. introduction
xhtml modularization [ xhtmlmod ] permits the development of xhtml modules and xhtml family markup languages. these modules and markup languages may, in turn, define local vocabulary items for use as values of attributes. this document describes the items that are available in the default xhtml vocabulary space:
http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml/vocab#
the xhtml metainformation module defined as part of xhtml+rdfa [ xhtmlrdfa ] specifies the following vocabulary items.
alternate
appendix
appendix  refers to a resource serving       as an appendix in a collection.
bookmark
bookmark  refers to a bookmark - a link       to a key entry point within an extended document.
cite
chapter
chapter  refers to a resource serving       as a chapter in a collection.
contents
contents  refers to a resource serving       as a table of contents.
copyright
first
first  refers the first item in a       collection (see also start and top).
glossary
glossary  refers to a resource       providing a glossary of terms.
help
icon
index
itsrules
itsrules  indicates that the designated       resource is an [ its ] rule set.
last
last  refers to the last resource in a       collection of resources.
license
license  refers to a resource that       defines the associated license.
meta
next
next  refers to the next resource       (after the current one) in an ordered collection of resources.
p3pv1
prev
prev  refers to a previous resource       (before the current one) in an ordered collection of resources.
role
role  indicates the purpose of the       resource. see the xhtml role       vocabulary for roles in this vocabulary space, and xhtmlrole for information on extending the collection of roles.
section
section  refers to a resource serving       as a section in a collection.
stylesheet
stylesheet  refers to a resource       serving as a stylesheet for a resource.
subsection
subsection  refers to a resource       serving as a subsection in a collection.
start
start  refers to the first resource in       a collection of resources.
top
up
up  refers to a resource "above" in a       hierarchically structured set.
3. xhtml role vocabulary
3.1 items from the xhtml role module
the values in this section are defined for use in the
role
banner
contains       the prime heading or internal title of a page.
complementary
indicates that the section supports but is       separable from the main content of resource.
contentinfo
contains meta information about the       content on the page or the page as a whole.
definition
main
navigation
indicates a collection of items suitable for       navigating the document or related documents.
note
indicates       the content is parenthetic or ancillary to the main content of the       resource.
search
3.2 items from the accessible rich internet applications vocabulary
alert
a message       with important, and usually time-sensitive, information. also see alertdialog       and status.
alertdialog
a       type of dialog that contains an alert message, where initial focus goes       an element within the dialog. also see alert and dialog.
application
a       region declared as a web application, as opposed to a web document.
article
a section       of a page that consists of a composition that forms an independent part       of a document, page, or site.
button
an input       that allows for user-triggered actions when clicked or pressed. also see link.
checkbox
a checkable       input that has three possible values: true, false, or mixed.
columnheader
combobox
a presentation       of a select; usually similar to a textbox where users can type ahead to       select an option, or type to enter arbitrary text as a new item in the       list. also see listbox.
dialog
a dialog       is an application window that is designed to interrupt the current processing       of an application in order to prompt the user to enter information or require       a response. also see alertdialog.
directory
a list       of references to members of a group, such as a static table of contents.
document
a region       containing related information that is declared as document content, as       opposed to a web application.
form
a landmark       region that contains a collection of items and objects that, as a whole,       combine to create a form. also see search.
grid
a grid is       an interactive control which contains cells of tabular data arranged in       rows and columns, like a table.
gridcell
group
a set of       user interface objects which are not intended to be included in a page       summary or table of contents by assistive technologies.
heading
img
a container       for a collection of elements that form an image.
link
an interactive       reference to an internal or external resource that, when activated, causes       the user agent to navigate to that resource. also see button.
list
listbox
a widget       that allows the user to select one or more items from a list of choices.       also see combobox and list.
listitem
log
a type of       live region where new information is added in meaningful order and old       information may disappear. also see marquee.
marquee
a type       of live region where non-essential information changes frequently. also       see log.
math
menu
a type of       widget that offers a list of choices to the user.
menubar
a presentation       of menu that usually remains visible and is usually presented horizontally.
menuitem
an option       in a group of choices contained by a menu or menubar.
menuitemcheckbox
a       checkable menuitem that has three possible values: true, false, or mixed.
menuitemradio
a       checkable menuitem in a group of menuitemradio roles, only one of which       can be checked at a time.
option
presentation
an       element whose implicit native role semantics will not be mapped to the       accessibility api.
progressbar
an       element that displays the progress status for tasks that take a long time.
radio
a checkable       input in a group of radio roles, only one of which can be checked at a       time.
radiogroup
region
a large       perceivable section of a web page or document, that the author feels is       important enough to be included in a page summary or table of contents,       for example, an area of the page containing live sporting event statistics.
row
rowgroup
a group       containing one or more row elements in a grid.
rowheader
a cell       containing header information for a row in a grid.
scrollbar
a graphical       object that controls the scrolling of content within a viewing area, regardless       of whether the content is fully displayed within the viewing area.
separator
a divider       that separates and distinguishes sections of content or groups of menuitems.
slider
a user       input where the user selects a value from within a given range.
spinbutton
a form       of range that expects a user to select from amongst discrete choices.
status
a container       whose content is advisory information for the user but is not important       enough to justify an alert. also see alert.
tab
a grouping       label providing a mechanism for selecting the tab content that is to be       rendered to the user.
tablist
a list       of tab elements, which are references to tabpanel elements.
tabpanel
a container       for the resources associated with a tab, where each tab is contained in       a tablist.
textbox
timer
a type of       live region containing a numerical counter which indicates an amount of       elapsed time from a start point, or the time remaining until an end point.
toolbar
a collection       of commonly used function buttons represented in compact visual form.
tooltip
a contextual       popup that displays a description for an element.
tree
a type of       list that may contain sub-level nested groups that can be collapsed and       expanded.
treegrid
a grid       whose rows can be expanded and collapsed in the same manner as for a tree.
treeitem
an option       item of a tree. this is an element within a tree that may be expanded or       collapsed if it contains a sub-level group of treeitems.
appendix a - references
available at: http://www.w3.org/tr/2013/rec-its20-20131029/
available at: http://www.w3.org/tr/2002/rec-p3p-20020416/
http://www.w3.org/tr/2008/rec-xhtml-modularization-20081008
[xhtmlrdfa]
http://www.w3.org/tr/2008/rec-rdfa-syntax-20081014.
[xhtmlrole]
last edited: 2010-01-27
xhtml vocabulary
xhtml vocabulary xhtml vocabulary this is a vocabulary collection utilized by xhtml family modules and document types using xhtml modularization , including xhtml role and xhtml + rdfa as defined in rdfa-syntax . the xhtml specifications are developed by the w3c xhtml 2 working group as part of the w3c html activity . for more information about xml , please refer to the extensible markup language ( xml ) 1.0 specification. version date: 2010-01-27 1. introduction xhtml modularization [ xhtmlmod ] permits the development of xhtml modules and xhtml family markup languages. these modules and markup languages may, in turn, define local vocabulary items for use as values of attributes. this document describes the items that are available in the default xhtml vocabulary space: http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml/vocab# . 2. xhtml metainformation vocabulary the xhtml metainformation module defined as part of xhtml+rdfa [ xhtmlrdfa ] specifies the following vocabulary items. alternate alternate designates alternate versions for a resource. appendix appendix refers to a resource serving as an appendix in a collection. bookmark bookmark refers to a bookmark - a link to a key entry point within an extended document. cite cite refers to a resource that defines a citation. chapter chapter refers to a resource serving as a chapter in a collection. contents contents refers to a resource serving as a table of contents. copyright copyright refers to a copyright statement for the resource. first first refers the first item in a collection (see also start and top). glossary glossary refers to a resource providing a glossary of terms. help help refers to a resource offering help. icon icon refers to a resource that represents an icon. index index refers to a resource providing an index. itsrules itsrules indicates that the designated resource is an [ its ] rule set. last last refers to the last resource in a collection of resources. license license refers to a resource that defines the associated license. meta meta refers to a resource that provides metadata. next next refers to the next resource (after the current one) in an ordered collection of resources. p3pv1 p3pv1 refers to a p3p policy reference file [ p3p ]. prev prev refers to a previous resource (before the current one) in an ordered collection of resources. role role indicates the purpose of the resource. see the xhtml role vocabulary for roles in this vocabulary space, and xhtmlrole for information on extending the collection of roles. section section refers to a resource serving as a section in a collection. stylesheet stylesheet refers to a resource serving as a stylesheet for a resource. subsection subsection refers to a resource serving as a subsection in a collection. start start refers to the first resource in a collection of resources. top top is a synonym for start. up up refers to a resource "above" in a hierarchically structured set. 3. xhtml role vocabulary 3.1 items from the xhtml role module the values in this section are defined for use in the role attribute as specified in the xhtml role attribute module . note that the values in section 2 and section 3.2 are also available. banner contains the prime heading or internal title of a page. complementary indicates that the section supports but is separable from the main content of resource. contentinfo contains meta information about the content on the page or the page as a whole. definition indicates the definition of a term or concept. main acts as the main content of the document. navigation indicates a collection of items suitable for navigating the document or related documents. note indicates the content is parenthetic or ancillary to the main content of the resource. search indicates that the section provides a search facility. 3.2 items from the accessible rich internet applications vocabulary alert a message with important, and usually time-sensitive, information. also see alertdialog and status. alertdialog a type of dialog that contains an alert message, where initial focus goes an element within the dialog. also see alert and dialog. application a region declared as a web application, as opposed to a web document. article a section of a page that consists of a composition that forms an independent part of a document, page, or site. button an input that allows for user-triggered actions when clicked or pressed. also see link. checkbox a checkable input that has three possible values: true, false, or mixed. columnheader a cell containing header information for a column. combobox a presentation of a select; usually similar to a textbox where users can type ahead to select an option, or type to enter arbitrary text as a new item in the list. also see listbox. dialog a dialog is an application window that is designed to interrupt the current processing of an application in order to prompt the user to enter information or require a response. also see alertdialog. directory a list of references to members of a group, such as a static table of contents. document a region containing related information that is declared as document content, as opposed to a web application. form a landmark region that contains a collection of items and objects that, as a whole, combine to create a form. also see search. grid a grid is an interactive control which contains cells of tabular data arranged in rows and columns, like a table. gridcell a cell in a grid or treegrid. group a set of user interface objects which are not intended to be included in a page summary or table of contents by assistive technologies. heading a heading for a section of the page. img a container for a collection of elements that form an image. link an interactive reference to an internal or external resource that, when activated, causes the user agent to navigate to that resource. also see button. list a group of non-interactive list items. also see listbox. listbox a widget that allows the user to select one or more items from a list of choices. also see combobox and list. listitem a single item in a list or directory. log a type of live region where new information is added in meaningful order and old information may disappear. also see marquee. marquee a type of live region where non-essential information changes frequently. also see log. math content that represents a mathematical expression. menu a type of widget that offers a list of choices to the user. menubar a presentation of menu that usually remains visible and is usually presented horizontally. menuitem an option in a group of choices contained by a menu or menubar. menuitemcheckbox a checkable menuitem that has three possible values: true, false, or mixed. menuitemradio a checkable menuitem in a group of menuitemradio roles, only one of which can be checked at a time. option a selectable item in a select list. presentation an element whose implicit native role semantics will not be mapped to the accessibility api. progressbar an element that displays the progress status for tasks that take a long time. radio a checkable input in a group of radio roles, only one of which can be checked at a time. radiogroup a group of radio buttons. region a large perceivable section of a web page or document, that the author feels is important enough to be included in a page summary or table of contents, for example, an area of the page containing live sporting event statistics. row a row of cells in a grid. rowgroup a group containing one or more row elements in a grid. rowheader a cell containing header information for a row in a grid. scrollbar a graphical object that controls the scrolling of content within a viewing area, regardless of whether the content is fully displayed within the viewing area. separator a divider that separates and distinguishes sections of content or groups of menuitems. slider a user input where the user selects a value from within a given range. spinbutton a form of range that expects a user to select from amongst discrete choices. status a container whose content is advisory information for the user but is not important enough to justify an alert. also see alert. tab a grouping label providing a mechanism for selecting the tab content that is to be rendered to the user. tablist a list of tab elements, which are references to tabpanel elements. tabpanel a container for the resources associated with a tab, where each tab is contained in a tablist. textbox input that allows free-form text as its value. timer a type of live region containing a numerical counter which indicates an amount of elapsed time from a start point, or the time remaining until an end point. toolbar a collection of commonly used function buttons represented in compact visual form. tooltip a contextual popup that displays a description for an element. tree a type of list that may contain sub-level nested groups that can be collapsed and expanded. treegrid a grid whose rows can be expanded and collapsed in the same manner as for a tree. treeitem an option item of a tree. this is an element within a tree that may be expanded or collapsed if it contains a sub-level group of treeitems. appendix a - references [its] " the internationalization tag set (its) version 2.0 ", w3c recommendation, david filip et al., 29 october 2013. available at: http://www.w3.org/tr/2013/rec-its20-20131029/ [p3p] " the platform for privacy preferences 1.0 (p3p1.0) specification ", w3c recommendation, l. cranor et al. , 16 april 2002. available at: http://www.w3.org/tr/2002/rec-p3p-20020416/ [ xhtmlmod ] xhtml modularization 1.1 , w3c recommendation, shane mccarron, et al. , 8 october 2008 http://www.w3.org/tr/2008/rec-xhtml-modularization-20081008 [xhtmlrdfa] " rdfa in xhtml: syntax and processing ", w3c recommendation, b. adida, et al. , 14 october 2008. http://www.w3.org/tr/2008/rec-rdfa-syntax-20081014. [xhtmlrole] " xhtml role attribute module ", w3c working draft, m. birbeck, et. al. 7 april 2008. http://www.w3.org/tr/2008/wd-xhtml-role-20080407 steven pemberton , w3c html activity lead last edited: 2010-01-27

Text: …jeg har bare sã¥ pokkers travlt…
jeg ville sã¥ gerne nã¥ at blogge om det lã¦kre spisested lã¦kkerier. og isbutikken froyo. ogâ min underlige smagsoplevelse pã¥ the mad hatter bubble tea emporium.â ogâ besã¸get iâ en afrikansk lille hule pã¥ mimersgade. og cafã©en, hvorâ rejseplanerne begyndte. men nu rejser jeg afsted om 1 time…
jeg skal til malaysia… med fire dejlige piger fra mit studie begiver jeg mig ud i en ukendt verden, hvor hver dag byder pã¥ nye eventyr, og fã¸rst om 3 ugers tid vender jeg tilbage til trygge nã¸rrebro (glã¦der mig allerede til at gã¥ over dronning louises bro <3â hjem er hjem).
sã¥ jeg dropper den dã¥rlige samvittighed over ikke at nã¥ alle blogindlã¦g (det var jo et af mine mã¥l i sommers !), og i stedet fã¥r i en masse dejlige stemningsbilleder. lad os kalde den “ude godt, men hjemme bedst”â�¤ der er bã¥de instagramfotos og andet gejl. enjoy
â 
â 
â 
â 
â 
â 
foruden den lã¦kre glã¸ggekstrakt , jeg har blogget om, bã¸d december mã¥ned ogsã¥ pã¥ andre alkoholiske kreationer. jeg begav mig nemlig ud i snapsebrygning til ã¥rets bloggerjulefrokost. og hvis jeg selv skal sige det, var det en succes. eftersom den ikke blev drukket op til julefrokosten, kom jeg den senere i en gryde glã¸gg (mums!), og den endte sine dage til familienjulefrokosten forleden, hvor den mã¥tte konkurrere mod en hjemmelavet periokonsnaps fra â€™92 samt en pã¦resnaps fra â€™94. sidstnã¦vnte blev lavet ved at sã¦tte en tom flaske pã¥ et pã¦reskud, sã¥ledes at pã¦ren kunne vokseâ sig stor og smuk inde i flasken, inden den blev overhã¦ldt med snaps. smart, tjekket og lidt vildere end min julesnaps. ikke desto mindre var min julesnaps populã¦r, og hver en drã¥be blev drukket op!
opskriften er ikke min egen, men samvirkes , sã¥ jeg vil ikke tage ã¦ren for den. dog blev den brygget pã¥ nã¸rrebro, sã¥ i fortjener opskriften. og i bã¸r lave den lige nu, sã¥ den kan stã¥ og trã¦kke til 1. december 2014â�¤
julesnaps
ingredienser:
fremgangsmã¥de:
start med at skrabe kornene ud af vaniljestangen og riv appelsinen.
find et pã¦nt glas eller flaske og bland kaffebã¸nner, kanelstang, appelsinskal og vaniljestang uden korn i glasset.
hã¦ld derefter vodka over og lad det trã¦kke sã¥ lang tid som muligt. jo lã¦ngere tid, jo bedre
server til julefrokosten eller i glã¸ggen og mã¦rk din hals blive renset pã¥ en julet mã¥de.
haps snaps.
det har vã¦ret den bedste december mã¥ned! kun fã¥ eksamener ogâ nã¦rmest ingen julestress, men derimod utroligt meget glã¸gg, mange gode snakke med gode mennesker, hyggelige julefrokoster og masser af god juleenergi. selv har jeg stadig en rest glã¸ggekstrakt tilbage, som jeg har gemt til min sã¸de freja til en kold januaraften, og ellers tror jeg mã¥ske, at jeg har fã¥et nok glã¸gg for i ã¥r.
stormyoga med glã¸gg
sund ã¦blekage med glã¸gg oveni eksamenslã¦sningen hos moar
i torsdags endte jeg med en dejlig veninde pã¥ props pã¥ blã¥gã¥rdsgade, hvor deâ  stadig serverede glã¸gg. vi tã¦nkte, at det var sidste chance for at fã¥ vores glã¸gghunger tilfredsstillet, sã¥ i stedet for et koldt glas rã¸dvin, valgte vi den varme drik. og efter et par timer havde vi indtaget tre glas hver og diskuteret hjemmelavet glã¸gg og nã¸rrebros bedste glã¸gg med nabobordet.
hold kã¦ft en god glã¸gg! jeg fandt den – endelig! hjemmelavet og fyldt med mandler og rosiner – hvad mere kan man ã¸nske sig? og en 50’er (noget dyrere end floras kaffebars og gavlens ) var helt i orden. sã¥ hvis i kan nã¥ det, sã¥ skynd jer ned pã¥ props og tã¸m tã¸nden.
det er ikke lige det skã¸nneste billede, men det var, hvad jeg kunne nã¥, inden glã¸ggen var vã¦k… senere endte viâ pã¥ altid dejlige mexibar, hvor passionfruit daquirien smagte, som den skulleâ�¤
i dag har jeg drukket lã¦kker kaffe pã¥ kaffesalonen med den kã¦re arash, og i aften stã¥r den pã¥ hygge med aravish og senere julebas med ohoi pã¥ stengade . det kan kun blive godt! nã¥r jeg vã¥gner i morgen, gã¥r turen til berlin, hvor jeg vil nyde de nã¦ste dage + nytã¥rsaften med min roomie og andre skã¸nne mennesker. det var lige en lille update her fra nã¸rrebro…
livet er en fest! enjoy it!
del med dine venner :)
like   loader...
…0g jeg har helt glemt kulturskabernes julekalenders sidste del, som jeg mangler at informere om. det bliver meget kort, da jeg er i gang med at forberede mig til julefrokost med bl.a. denne skã¸nne kvinde og denne
jeg har brygget en julesnaps og lavet hummus, og det bliver spã¦ndende at se, hvad de andre mon har fundet pã¥… aftenen (og natten) skal nok blive god!
men men men, her kommer sidste del af julekalenderen fra i morgen til d. 24. jeg har desvã¦rre ikke tid til at give en beskrivelse af hvert arrangement, men klik pã¥ linket for at lã¦se mere om det:
sã¸g pã¥ nã¸rrebro
sã¸g efter:
hvad skriver jeg mest om?
oversigt
slut dig til de 60, der fã¸lger denne blog
e-mail tjek mislykkedes, prã¸v igen
beklager, din blog kan ikke dele indlã¦g via e-mail.

noerrebro | fra alle hjørner
noerrebro | fra alle hjørner hvem er jeg, og hvorfor lige nørrebro? antikvariater bland-selv-slik butikker caféer events gåture ikkenørrebro musik nørrebro nørrebro’ske opskrifter restauranter street art take away noerrebro fra alle hjørner forside jeg har ikke glemt nørrebro… 1 kommentar posted by noerrebro på april 11, 2014 …jeg har bare så pokkers travlt…   mimersparken taget af denne dejlige kvinde del med dine venner :) del facebook e-mail pinterest twitter tumblr linkedin udskriv google synes godt om dette: like loader... gåture , nørrebro mimersparken , nørrebro ude godt, men hjemme bedst 4 kommentarer posted by noerrebro på januar 9, 2014 jeg ville så gerne nå at blogge om det lækre spisested lækkerier. og isbutikken froyo. og min underlige smagsoplevelse på the mad hatter bubble tea emporium. og besøget i en afrikansk lille hule på mimersgade. og caféen, hvor rejseplanerne begyndte. men nu rejser jeg afsted om 1 time… jeg skal til malaysia… med fire dejlige piger fra mit studie begiver jeg mig ud i en ukendt verden, hvor hver dag byder på nye eventyr, og først om 3 ugers tid vender jeg tilbage til trygge nørrebro (glæder mig allerede til at gå over dronning louises bro <3 hjem er hjem). så jeg dropper den dårlige samvittighed over ikke at nå alle blogindlæg (det var jo et af mine mål i sommers !), og i stedet får i en masse dejlige stemningsbilleder. lad os kalde den “ude godt, men hjemme bedst”❤ der er både instagramfotos og andet gejl. enjoy             vi ses❤ del med dine venner :) del facebook e-mail pinterest twitter tumblr linkedin udskriv google synes godt om dette: like loader... nørrebro malaysia julesnaps 2 kommentarer posted by noerrebro på januar 8, 2014 foruden den lækre gløggekstrakt , jeg har blogget om, bød december måned også på andre alkoholiske kreationer. jeg begav mig nemlig ud i snapsebrygning til årets bloggerjulefrokost. og hvis jeg selv skal sige det, var det en succes. eftersom den ikke blev drukket op til julefrokosten, kom jeg den senere i en gryde gløgg (mums!), og den endte sine dage til familienjulefrokosten forleden, hvor den måtte konkurrere mod en hjemmelavet periokonsnaps fra ’92 samt en pæresnaps fra ’94. sidstnævnte blev lavet ved at sætte en tom flaske på et pæreskud, således at pæren kunne vokse sig stor og smuk inde i flasken, inden den blev overhældt med snaps. smart, tjekket og lidt vildere end min julesnaps. ikke desto mindre var min julesnaps populær, og hver en dråbe blev drukket op! opskriften er ikke min egen, men samvirkes , så jeg vil ikke tage æren for den. dog blev den brygget på nørrebro, så i fortjener opskriften. og i bør lave den lige nu, så den kan stå og trække til 1. december 2014❤ julesnaps ingredienser: 1 økologisk appelsin 1 vaniljestang 20 kaffebønner 1 kanelstang 1 flaske vodka fremgangsmåde: start med at skrabe kornene ud af vaniljestangen og riv appelsinen. find et pænt glas eller flaske og bland kaffebønner, kanelstang, appelsinskal og vaniljestang uden korn i glasset. hæld derefter vodka over og lad det trække så lang tid som muligt. jo længere tid, jo bedre server til julefrokosten eller i gløggen og mærk din hals blive renset på en julet måde. haps snaps. del med dine venner :) del facebook e-mail pinterest twitter tumblr linkedin udskriv google synes godt om dette: like loader... nørrebro , nørrebro'ske opskrifter appelsin , hjemmelavet snaps , julefrokost , julesnaps , kaffebønner , kanelstang , pæresnaps , perikonsnaps , samvirke , snaps , vaniljestang , vodka den bedste gløgg på nørrebro skriv en kommentar posted by noerrebro på december 28, 2013 det har været den bedste december måned! kun få eksamener og nærmest ingen julestress, men derimod utroligt meget gløgg, mange gode snakke med gode mennesker, hyggelige julefrokoster og masser af god juleenergi. selv har jeg stadig en rest gløggekstrakt tilbage, som jeg har gemt til min søde freja til en kold januaraften, og ellers tror jeg måske, at jeg har fået nok gløgg for i år. stormyoga med gløgg sund æblekage med gløgg oveni eksamenslæsningen hos moar i torsdags endte jeg med en dejlig veninde på props på blågårdsgade, hvor de  stadig serverede gløgg. vi tænkte, at det var sidste chance for at få vores gløgghunger tilfredsstillet, så i stedet for et koldt glas rødvin, valgte vi den varme drik. og efter et par timer havde vi indtaget tre glas hver og diskuteret hjemmelavet gløgg og nørrebros bedste gløgg med nabobordet. hold kæft en god gløgg! jeg fandt den – endelig! hjemmelavet og fyldt med mandler og rosiner – hvad mere kan man ønske sig? og en 50’er (noget dyrere end floras kaffebars og gavlens ) var helt i orden. så hvis i kan nå det, så skynd jer ned på props og tøm tønden. det er ikke lige det skønneste billede, men det var, hvad jeg kunne nå, inden gløggen var væk… senere endte vi på altid dejlige mexibar, hvor passionfruit daquirien smagte, som den skulle❤ i dag har jeg drukket lækker kaffe på kaffesalonen med den kære arash, og i aften står den på hygge med aravish og senere julebas med ohoi på stengade . det kan kun blive godt! når jeg vågner i morgen, går turen til berlin, hvor jeg vil nyde de næste dage + nytårsaften med min roomie og andre skønne mennesker. det var lige en lille update her fra nørrebro… livet er en fest! enjoy it! del med dine venner :) del facebook e-mail pinterest twitter tumblr linkedin udskriv google synes godt om dette: like loader... caféer , events , nørrebro berlin , gløgg , jul på nørrebro , julebass , kaffesalonen , mexibar , nørrebros bedste gløgg , ohoi , stengade tiden går… skriv en kommentar posted by noerrebro på december 20, 2013 …0g jeg har helt glemt kulturskabernes julekalenders sidste del, som jeg mangler at informere om. det bliver meget kort, da jeg er i gang med at forberede mig til julefrokost med bl.a. denne skønne kvinde og denne jeg har brygget en julesnaps og lavet hummus, og det bliver spændende at se, hvad de andre mon har fundet på… aftenen (og natten) skal nok blive god! men men men, her kommer sidste del af julekalenderen fra i morgen til d. 24. jeg har desværre ikke tid til at give en beskrivelse af hvert arrangement, men klik på linket for at læse mere om det: 21. december: forpremiere på disneys animationsfilm frost 22. december: midnatsbadning og vintersolhverv 23. december: julehistorier i møllegades boghandel 24. december: stengade inviterer til juleboogie   og nyd så julen!❤ del med dine venner :) del facebook e-mail pinterest twitter tumblr linkedin udskriv google synes godt om sankt hans gade sankt hans torv slikbutik smoothie sortedamssøen soupanatural stengade street art streetart støberiet sund sult søerne teater grob vegansk vegetarmiddag mine nyeste indlæg jeg har ikke glemt nørrebro… ude godt, men hjemme bedst julesnaps den bedste gløgg på nørrebro tiden går… gløgg på floras kaffebar og bevar’s tillykke til bevar’s nørrebro’sk gløggekstrakt nørrebros julekalender fortsat nørrebros julekalender juletræet tændes på hjørnet af sankt hans gade og ryesgade ligger… mens jeg er væk, kan i jo… life is short – eat dessert first! friluftsland v. anna birk topindlæg & Text: authors
rel
html4 definition of the 'rel' attribute. here are some additional values, each of which can be used or omitted in any combination (unless otherwise noted, and except where prohibited by law) and their meanings,
symmetry
transitivity
and
inverse
if any.   please see the xfn home page for more information about xfn .
friendship (pick at most one)
contact
someone you know how to get in touch with. often symmetric.
acquaintance
someone who you have exchanged greetings and not much (if any) more — maybe a short conversation or two. often symmetric.
friend
someone you are a friend to. a compatriot, buddy, home(boy|girl) that you know. often symmetric.
physical
met
professional
co-worker
someone a person works with, or works at the same organization as. symmetric.  usually transitive.
colleague
someone in the same field of study/activity. symmetric. often transitive.
geographical (pick at most one)
co-resident
someone you share a street address with.  symmetric and transitive.
neighbor
someone who lives nearby, perhaps only at an adjacent street address or doorway.  symmetric. often transitive.
family (pick at most one)
child
a person's genetic offspring, or someone that a person has adopted and takes care of. inverse is parent.
parent
someone a person shares a parent with.  symmetric. usually transitive.
spouse
kin
a relative, someone you consider part of your extended family. symmetric and typically transitive.
romantic
muse
crush
date
sweetheart
someone with whom you are intimate and at least somewhat committed, typically exclusively. symmetric. not transitive.
identity
me
a link to yourself at a different url. exclusive of all other xfn values. required symmetric. there is an implicit "me" relation from the contents of a directory to the directory itself.
acknowledgments
copyright
xfn 1.1 profile
xfn 1.1 profile xfn 1.1 relationships meta data profile authors tantek çelik matthew mullenweg eric meyer as described in html4 meta data profiles . rel html4 definition of the 'rel' attribute. here are some additional values, each of which can be used or omitted in any combination (unless otherwise noted, and except where prohibited by law) and their meanings, symmetry , transitivity and inverse if any. please see the xfn home page for more information about xfn . friendship (pick at most one) contact someone you know how to get in touch with. often symmetric. acquaintance someone who you have exchanged greetings and not much (if any) more — maybe a short conversation or two. often symmetric. friend someone you are a friend to. a compatriot, buddy, home(boy|girl) that you know. often symmetric. physical met someone who you have actually met in person. symmetric. professional co-worker someone a person works with, or works at the same organization as. symmetric. usually transitive. colleague someone in the same field of study/activity. symmetric. often transitive. geographical (pick at most one) co-resident someone you share a street address with. symmetric and transitive. neighbor someone who lives nearby, perhaps only at an adjacent street address or doorway. symmetric. often transitive. family (pick at most one) child a person's genetic offspring, or someone that a person has adopted and takes care of. inverse is parent. parent inverse of child. sibling someone a person shares a parent with. symmetric. usually transitive. spouse someone you are married to. symmetric. not transitive. kin a relative, someone you consider part of your extended family. symmetric and typically transitive. romantic muse someone who brings you inspiration. no inverse. crush someone you have a crush on. no inverse. date someone you are dating. symmetric. not transitive. sweetheart someone with whom you are intimate and at least somewhat committed, typically exclusively. symmetric. not transitive. identity me a link to yourself at a different url. exclusive of all other xfn values. required symmetric. there is an implicit "me" relation from the contents of a directory to the directory itself. acknowledgments please see our thanks page for acknowledgments. copyright copyright © 2003–2016 gmpg . some rights reserved .
tantek çelik
matthew mullenweg
eric meyer

xfn 1.1 profile xfn 1.1 relationships meta data profile authors tantek çelik matthew mullenweg eric meyer as described in html4 meta data profiles . rel html4 definition of the 'rel' attribute. here are some additional values, each of which can be used or omitted in any combination (unless otherwise noted, and except where prohibited by law) and their meanings, symmetry , transitivity and inverse if any. please see the xfn home page for more information about xfn . friendship (pick at most one) contact someone you know how to get in touch with. often symmetric. acquaintance someone who you have exchanged greetings and not much (if any) more — maybe a short conversation or two. often symmetric. friend someone you are a friend to. a compatriot, buddy, home(boy|girl) that you know. often symmetric. physical met someone who you have actually met in person. symmetric. professional co-worker someone a person works with, or works at the same organization as. symmetric. usually transitive. colleague someone in the same field of study/activity. symmetric. often transitive. geographical (pick at most one) co-resident someone you share a street address with. symmetric and transitive. neighbor someone who lives nearby, perhaps only at an adjacent street address or doorway. symmetric. often transitive. family (pick at most one) child a person's genetic offspring, or someone that a person has adopted and takes care of. inverse is parent. parent inverse of child. sibling someone a person shares a parent with. symmetric. usually transitive. spouse someone you are married to. symmetric. not transitive. kin a relative, someone you consider part of your extended family. symmetric and typically transitive. romantic muse someone who brings you inspiration. no inverse. crush someone you have a crush on. no inverse. date someone you are dating. symmetric. not transitive. sweetheart someone with whom you are intimate and at least somewhat committed, typically exclusively. symmetric. not transitive. identity me a link to yourself at a different url. exclusive of all other xfn values. required symmetric. there is an implicit "me" relation from the contents of a directory to the directory itself. acknowledgments please see our thanks page for acknowledgments. copyright copyright © 2003–2016 gmpg . some rights reserved .
tantek çelik
matthew mullenweg
eric meyer
html4 meta data profiles
html4 definition of the 'rel' attribute.
xfn home page
thanks page

get started  next  sign up  next    almost  done!    log in
log in
tumblr is so easy to use that it’s hard to explain.
we made it really, really simple for people to make a blog and put whatever they want on it. stories, photos, gifs, tv shows, links, quips, dumb jokes, smart jokes, spotify tracks, mp3s, videos, fashion, art, deep stuff. tumblr is 308 million different blogs, filled with literally whatever.
tumblr is blogs.
turns out that when you make it easy to create interesting things, that’s exactly what people do. all those great, random blogs your friends send you, those are tumblr blogs. we’ll help you find and follow blogs like that, and we’ll help other people find and follow yours.
you already know how this works.
once you follow a blog, all of its posts show up in your dashboard, just like you’d expect. see something great? reblog it to your own blog. add commentary if you like. make it your own. other people will do the same to your posts. that’s how you meet people here.
seriously, put anything you want here.
seven post types to get you started. your brain can do the rest. this thing is yours. use it however you like.
tumblelog, blog, tumblog, tumbler, tumblr, tlog, microblog

url:http://www.bakkenbears.com/nyhedsarkiv/305-fem-unge-i-bearstruppen/,date:null,extSize:6644,extDblChar:102,C1a:0,C2a:1 +45,C2b:n,C3a:3 ø#æ#å,C3b:10 to#toe#aar#oge#for#do#son#aarhus#tor#go,C3c:0,C3d:0,C3e:0,C3f:0,C3g:2 to#aarhus,C4a:da,C4b:da: HIGH (0.999995),C5a:2 af#lige,C5b:0,C6a:63 nye#danske#bare#så#blive#været#give#vi#de#mange#skal#i#vej#sin#en#ved#er#sig#to#han#har#på#forbindelse#blevet#med#fra#men#eneste#at#michael#af#til#for#ny#andet#anden#vil#helt#om#sammen#og#os#mand#kan#som#udvikle#historie#spille#der#kom#del#den#bruge#udgøre#danmark#lige#hjælp#også#have#fik#år#presse#ikke,C6b:2 danmark#dansk,C6c:0,C6d:53 nye#danske#bare#så#blive#været#vi#de#mange#skal#vej#en#ved#er#sig#han#har#på#forbindelse#blevet#med#fra#eneste#af#til#ny#andet#vil#anden#helt#sammen#om#og#os#mand#kan#som#udvikle#historie#spille#der#kom#den#bruge#udgøre#danmark#lige#hjælp#også#fik#år#presse#ikke,C7a:1 aarhus,C7b:0,C7c:32 ns#høj#ore#by#rup#lt#bo#ie#ager#ker#lse#ør#lok#ov#øre#lev#inge#øv#or#øje#å#mark#ing#rød#nse#aa#marke#er#ved#skov#sig#trup,C7d:2 rup#trup,C7e:1 danmark,C7f:0,C7g:1 aarhus,C7h:0,C8a:2 lev#kl,C8b:0,C8c:0,C9a:1 aps,C9b:1 iss,C9c:0,C9d:0,C9e:0,C9f:n,C10a:4 iversen#kristensen#christoffersen#sørensen,C10b:8 inge#kristensen#michael#sørensen#morten#thomas#søren#anne,C10c:3 kristensen#morten#sørensen,C15a:y,C15b:com,C16a:,C17a:4,C18a:,intDanish:0.0,Source:NETARKIVET,calcDanishCode:110
Text: oprettet d.
08/07 2016
i sæsonen 2016/17 vil fem unge drenge udgøre en værsentlig del af bakken bears-truppen. de fem vil træne med bearsholdet og have dobbeltlicens, så de kan spille på bearsholdet og samtidig på farmerholdet i 1. division, ebaa.
kristoffer løwenstein, der er opvokset i skovbakkens ungdomsafdeling, er den ældste og mest erfarne af de fem. den 22-årige guard fik sin debut i efteråret 2012 og har spillet 71 kampe.
mathias thibault er den anden erfarne af de to. thibault fik sin basketballopvækst i solrød inden han i 2013 kom til aarhus for at blive en del af talentakademiet ebaa. den 19-årige guard har spillet 21 kampe i bearsuniformen.
sylvester berg, der ligesom løwenstein er opvokset i skovbakken, spiller sin anden sæson i bearstrøjen. berg, der er forward, er lige blevet 18 år, men er alligevel noteret for 23 optrædener i bearstrøjen. han deltager ved sommeren u-18 em i makedonien.
david kristensen er ny i bearstrøjen. den i viby-uddannede forward trænede med bearsholdet i efteråret 2015 i forbindelse med skader og andet fravær i truppen, men har ikke fået debut for bears. kristensen er blot 17 år og også med i u-18-landsholdstruppen.
den eneste helt nye mand er marius sørensen, der har fået sin basketballopdragelse i bmi. den 18-årige guard har – som de fire ovenfor nævnte – været en del af ebaa og skal bruge starten på sæsonen til at vænne sig til tempoet og fysikken i basketligaen.
med de fem spillere har bears en trup bestående af flg. spillere:
guards: adama darboe, thomas lærke, kristoffer løwenstein, mathias thibault, marius sørensen
forwards: nicolai iversen, morten sahlertz, dwayne benjamin, sylvester berg, david kristensen
centere: chris christoffersen, keane thomann, michel diouf
der forventes tilføjet yderligere to spillere inden kampsæsonen starter i slutningen af september.
follow us
basketball og netværk
med 14 dm-titler og 10 pokaltrofæer på kontoen har klubben ikke bare markeret lokalt, men sat aarhus og bakken bears sig på danmarkskortet. vi forsøger løbende at bidrage til udviklingen af basketball som sport i danmark. vi ønsker at højne niveauet i den danske basketballrække og give basketballfans verdensklasse-underholdning til kampene i vejlby risskov hallen.
med hjælp fra de mange passionerede frivillige og samarbejdet med basketballklubberne i området ønsker vi at udvikle klubben og sporten sammen med klubbens erhvervsnetværk, som er blandt de bedste i regionen – og vi byder jævnligt nye samarbejdspartnere velkomne.
follow us
fem unge i bearstruppen - nyhedsarkiv - bakken bears
fem unge i bearstruppen - nyhedsarkiv - bakken bears team om bears holdet træning klubbens historie hall of fame nyhedsarkiv grizzly news organisationen vision og værdier kontakt os games kampe tidligere sæsoner ligastilling (basketligaen.dk) slutspillet bib 10k gamenight billetter hjemmebane – find vej reglerne faq basket ordbogen club 100 grizzly dance team underholdning bear toss community ebaa bears camp shop sponsor sponsorer odendo sponsorer bliv sponsor bearsplus netværk sponsor- og netværksafdelingen media iversen på go!fm presse nyhedsarkiv grizzly news billeder (flickr.com) nyhedsarkiv fem unge i bearstruppen oprettet d. 08/07 2016 i sæsonen 2016/17 vil fem unge drenge udgøre en værsentlig del af bakken bears-truppen. de fem vil træne med bearsholdet og have dobbeltlicens, så de kan spille på bearsholdet og samtidig på farmerholdet i 1. division, ebaa. kristoffer løwenstein, der er opvokset i skovbakkens ungdomsafdeling, er den ældste og mest erfarne af de fem. den 22-årige guard fik sin debut i efteråret 2012 og har spillet 71 kampe. mathias thibault er den anden erfarne af de to. thibault fik sin basketballopvækst i solrød inden han i 2013 kom til aarhus for at blive en del af talentakademiet ebaa. den 19-årige guard har spillet 21 kampe i bearsuniformen. sylvester berg, der ligesom løwenstein er opvokset i skovbakken, spiller sin anden sæson i bearstrøjen. berg, der er forward, er lige blevet 18 år, men er alligevel noteret for 23 optrædener i bearstrøjen. han deltager ved sommeren u-18 em i makedonien. david kristensen er ny i bearstrøjen. den i viby-uddannede forward trænede med bearsholdet i efteråret 2015 i forbindelse med skader og andet fravær i truppen, men har ikke fået debut for bears. kristensen er blot 17 år og også med i u-18-landsholdstruppen. den eneste helt nye mand er marius sørensen, der har fået sin basketballopdragelse i bmi. den 18-årige guard har – som de fire ovenfor nævnte – været en del af ebaa og skal bruge starten på sæsonen til at vænne sig til tempoet og fysikken i basketligaen. med de fem spillere har bears en trup bestående af flg. spillere: guards: adama darboe, thomas lærke, kristoffer løwenstein, mathias thibault, marius sørensen forwards: nicolai iversen, morten sahlertz, dwayne benjamin, sylvester berg, david kristensen centere: chris christoffersen, keane thomann, michel diouf der forventes tilføjet yderligere to spillere inden kampsæsonen starter i slutningen af september. follow us hovedsponsor øvrige sponsorer basketball og netværk med 14 dm-titler og 10 pokaltrofæer på kontoen har klubben ikke bare markeret lokalt, men sat aarhus og bakken bears sig på danmarkskortet. vi forsøger løbende at bidrage til udviklingen af basketball som sport i danmark. vi ønsker at højne niveauet i den danske basketballrække og give basketballfans verdensklasse-underholdning til kampene i vejlby risskov hallen. med hjælp fra de mange passionerede frivillige og samarbejdet med basketballklubberne i området ønsker vi at udvikle klubben og sporten sammen med klubbens erhvervsnetværk, som er blandt de bedste i regionen – og vi byder jævnligt nye samarbejdspartnere velkomne. follow us contact bakken bears aps. vejlby-risskov hallen 8240 risskov e-mail: info@bakkenbears.com sportsdirektør michael piloz tlf: 411 666 33 mp@bakkenbears.com salgsafdeling ravnsøvej 7 8240 risskov telefon: +45 86 770 700 e-mail: sponsor@bakkenbears.com © 2015 bakken bears. all rights reserved.

itunes
itunes is the world's easiest way to organize and add to your digital media collection.
we are unable to find itunes on your computer. to download the free app messenger by facebook, inc., get itunes now.
already have itunes? click i have itunes to open it now.
description
instantly reach the people in your life—for free. messenger is just like texting, but you don't have to pay for every message (it works with your data plan).
not just for facebook friends: message people in your phone book and just enter a phone number to add a new contact.
group chats: create groups for the people you message most. name them, set group photos and keep them all in one place.
photos and videos: shoot videos and snap selfies or other photos right from the app and send them with one tap.
free calls: talk as long as you want, even with people in other countries. (calls are free over wi-fi. otherwise, standard data charges apply.)
even more ways to message:
bring your conversations to life with stickers.
preview your camera roll photos and videos without leaving the conversation--then choose the perfect ones to send.
record voice messages when you have more to say.
extra features:
know when people have seen your messages.
forward messages or photos to people who weren't in the conversation.
search for people and groups to quickly get back to them.
turn on location to let people know when you're nearby.
see who's available on messenger and who's active on facebook.
turn off notifications when you're working, sleeping or just need a break.
what's new in version 81.0
we update the app regularly so we can make it better for you. get the latest version for all of the available features and improvements. thanks for using messenger!
screenshots
by                    littlelibrarykoala
hello there,
i would suggest that messenger be fixed with certain things. i have had trouble telling when a person has received and checked my message as well as who has done so because the icon of a person's profile picture doesn't pop up right away. i would also like to suggest that you fix it so that emojis sent aren't glitchy. sometimes the emojis appear as the iphone version and other times as the facebook version. so that needs to be fixed. i hope you make more emojis have actions that occur such more weather and sports ones. also animals and flowers would be fun. also do animations for like the hand movement ones. i would also like if the chat colors were expanded to include more colors such as gray, black, white, and darker and lighter hues of colors to make it more interesting. i am also interested to see if you could make like group video chats with members in your group. overall i love the app, but needs some improvements to make it even better.
ugh
by                    soup food
*facebook keeps putting out fake updates to temporarily hide bad ratings, and i will check back, 'update' and refresh my 1 star as often as i have to*
i do not want notifications, especially since i already get them for the facebook app!! i do not want people to be able to track my usage or see if i've read or received their messages!! i keep updating and deleting this stupid app in the hopes that you will make it less horrible, but it just keeps getting worse! i meant to say no notifications the first time you asked. do not ask me 4 more times in a row, and then force a red badge on the notifications icon!! this app would be so handy if you guys weren't so aggressively trying to force me to use it! deleted. again. you should also probably stop trying to trick me into downloading the app again by sending bogus message notifications to the main facebook app- it just reminds me to refresh my 1 star rating for the newest update.
night mode ?
by                    a d0000d
so i have used messenger for quite a while now. the problem i have with this is that the white background is just so bright at night. so it would be awesome if there was a night mode. or making the background  interchangeable. or both. either way if it is anything but white (darker color preferred) it would be awesome. other than i don't have any huge issues with it. it gets a little bit laggy sometimes but it's probably because of old software....

fjern

varen blev fjernet fra ã¸nskelisten
1
installer
nã¥ ã¸jeblikkeligt og gratis ud til personer i dit liv. messenger er helt som at sende sms'er, men du skal ikke betale for hver enkelt besked (det hã¸rer under dit dataaonnement).
ikke kun for facebook-venner: send beskeder til personer i din telefonbog, og indtast blot et telefonnummer for at tilfã¸je en ny kontakt.
gruppechatsamtaler: opret grupper for de personer, du sender flest beskeder til. navngiv dem, angiv gruppebilleder, og hav dem alle samlet pã¥ et sted.
billeder og videoer: optag videoer, og tag selfies eller andre billeder direkte fra appen, og send dem med et enkelt tryk.
chathoveder: hold gang i samtalen, mens du bruger andre apps.
gratis opkald: tal sã¥ lã¦nge, du vil, selv med personer i andre lande (opkald er gratis via wi-fi. ellers er standardtakster for data gã¦ldende).
endnu flere mã¥der at sende beskder pã¥:
gã¸r dine samtaler livlige med klistermã¦rker.
fã¥ forhã¥ndsvist billeder og videoer i dit galleri uden at forlade samtalen. derefter kan du vã¦lge lige nã¸jagtig dem, du vil sende.
optag indtalte beskeder, nã¥r du har mere at sige.
ekstra funktioner:
fã¥ det vist, nã¥r dine beskeder er blevet set.
videresend beskeder eller billeder til personer, der ikke var med i samtalen.
sã¸g efter personer og grupper for hurtigt at vende tilbage til dem.
aktivã©r placering, sã¥ folk ved, nã¥r du er i nã¦rheden.
se, hvem der er tilgã¦ngelig pã¥ messenger, og hvem der er aktiv pã¥ facebook.
opret genveje, sã¥ du nemt kan finde enhver samtale direkte fra din startskã¦rm.
deaktiver notifikationer, nã¥r du arbejder, sover eller bare har brug for en pause.
forbliv logget pã¥, sã¥ du aldrig gã¥r glip af en besked.
lã¦s mere
brugeranmeldelser
modbydelig og pã¥trã¦ngende  overtager fuldstã¦ndig ens telefon/tablet, snager i og forstyrrer privatlivet og lukker op for alskens russiske ludere og amerikanske bã¸rssvindlere! er rã¸get ud igen!
irriterende at man skal have den for at bruge facebook. bliver kun langsommere hver gang der er en opdatering ðÿ˜ ðÿ˜ ðÿ˜ 
elendig tvang  bliver ved med at af- og installere denne, da jeg nogle gange bliver nã¸dt til at lã¦se fb-beskeder pã¥ telefonen. jeg hader app'en, da man ikke kan slã¥ push beskeder fra mere end 24 timer, den suger strã¸m og den har adgang til mere end godt er.
tvang!  utroligt at man skal tvinges til at bruge den! den koster ogsã¥ rigtig meget strã¸m. men jeg anmoder min browser om pc-version, og sã¥ kan jeg gã¥ ind og lã¦se beskederne pã¥ telefonen alligevel ;-)

latterligt  at man skal bruge den,  for at kunne svare pã¥ en simpel besked pã¥ facebook.  tvang at jeg har den,  da man efterhã¥nden er trã¦t at at skal tã¦nde computeren hver  gang man skal svare nogen.

grimme emojies  de er mega klamme ad fjern dem

glad for den, men.  forstã¥r ikke folks problem med sms i messenger de kan jo bare slã¥ det fra, pã¥ den anden side nã¥r de laver opdatering sã¥ skulle de fokuserer pã¥ at udbedre fejl istedet for at tilfã¸je gejl man ikke bruger, min begyndte at skã¦re ord ud af beskeder jeg modtager og jeg sender og stickers kan jeg ikke altid se, selvom der er kommet utallige opdateringer siden den begyndte sã¥ har de ikke rettet fejlen.
skod app.... mon der er en grund til at fb tvinger folk til at bruge den ðÿ˜‰
vã¦rste opdatering i facebook hiwtorie  hvad er det smarte i at blande beskeder og sms'er? i har tã¦nkt med rã¸ven og i burde fyre dem har lavet den her opdatering
krã¦ver for mange tilladelser  lad os nu bruge browser! hvad jeg skriver i en sms kommer ikke jer ved &gt;:(
ok  man behã¸ver ikke at logge pã¥ med sit nummer,  det fungerer fint her, og blander sig ikke i mine sms beskeder....
smilys  hvordan pokker fã¥r jeg de gamle tilbage? de her nye er da noget lort ðÿ˜¡
hader  den!  irriterende og totalt spild af plads pã¥ mobilen. skifter snart fra facebook til google!
sanne 22. juli 2016

hygge kort musik ord quiz rollespil ræs simulation sport spænding strategi undervisning familie til børn op til 5 år til børn på 6-8 år til børn fra 9 år action og eventyr hjernegymnastik kreativitet musik og video rolleleg uddannelse start hitlister nye udgivelser indstillinger android enhedsadministrator bedste udvikler messenger 29.168.083 facebook kommunikation pegi 3 indlæser enhedskompatibilitet... føj til ønskeliste tilføjer... føjet til ønskelisten fjern fjerner... varen blev føjet til ønskelisten varen blev fjernet fra ønskelisten 1 installer nå øjeblikkeligt og gratis ud til personer i dit liv. messenger er helt som at sende sms'er, men du skal ikke betale for hver enkelt besked (det hører under dit dataaonnement). ikke kun for facebook-venner: send beskeder til personer i din telefonbog, og indtast blot et telefonnummer for at tilføje en ny kontakt. gruppechatsamtaler: opret grupper for de personer, du sender flest beskeder til. navngiv dem, angiv gruppebilleder, og hav dem alle samlet på et sted. billeder og videoer: optag videoer, og tag selfies eller andre billeder direkte fra appen, og send dem med et enkelt tryk. chathoveder: hold gang i samtalen, mens du bruger andre apps. gratis opkald: tal så længe, du vil, selv med personer i andre lande (opkald er gratis via wi-fi. ellers er standardtakster for data gældende). endnu flere måder at sende beskder på: gør dine samtaler livlige med klistermærker. få forhåndsvist billeder og videoer i dit galleri uden at forlade samtalen. derefter kan du vælge lige nøjagtig dem, du vil sende. optag indtalte beskeder, når du har mere at sige. ekstra funktioner: få det vist, når dine beskeder er blevet set. videresend beskeder eller billeder til personer, der ikke var med i samtalen. søg efter personer og grupper for hurtigt at vende tilbage til dem. aktivér placering, så folk ved, når du er i nærheden. se, hvem der er tilgængelig på messenger, og hvem der er aktiv på facebook. opret genveje, så du nemt kan finde enhver samtale direkte fra din startskærm. deaktiver notifikationer, når du arbejder, sover eller bare har brug for en pause. forbliv logget på, så du aldrig går glip af en besked. læs mere min anmeldelse anmeldelse fra anmeldelser 3,9 29.168.083 i alt 5 15.886.135 4 4.579.599 3 2.867.102 2 1.408.497 1 4.426.662 brugbarhed nyeste bedømmelse brugbarhed tue pol halvorsen modbydelig og påtrængende overtager fuldstændig ens telefon/tablet, snager i og forstyrrer privatlivet og lukker op for alskens russiske ludere og amerikanske børssvindlere! er røget ud igen! kenneth thorup irriterende at man skal have den for at bruge facebook. bliver kun langsommere hver gang der er en opdatering 😠😠😠 johannes pries pries elendig tvang bliver ved med at af- og installere denne, da jeg nogle gange bliver nødt til at læse fb-beskeder på telefonen. jeg hader app'en, da man ikke kan slå push beskeder fra mere end 24 timer, den suger strøm og den har adgang til mere end godt er. thomas mikkelsen-schmidt tvang! utroligt at man skal tvinges til at bruge den! den koster også rigtig meget strøm. men jeg anmoder min browser om pc-version, og så kan jeg gå ind og læse beskederne på telefonen alligevel ;-) chris corfitsen under al kritik sløv og besværlig app, der skal installeres, fordi facebook vil have adgang til at kunne læse alt på ens telefon. bare fordi man ikke vil lade dem snage i ens privatliv. skuffende. john brixen latterligt at man skal bruge den, for at kunne svare på en simpel besked på facebook. tvang at jeg har den, da man efterhånden er træt at at skal tænde computeren hver gang man skal svare nogen. brugeranmeldelser tue pol halvorsen 29. juli 2016 modbydelig og påtrængende overtager fuldstændig ens telefon/tablet, snager i og
